InvestPage.title: Invest in Somalia
InvestPage.description: Unlocking the potential of the Horn of Africa. A frontier for growth and innovation.

cards.title: Strategic Location
cards.description: The gateway to the Red Sea and Indian Ocean, connecting African markets to the Middle East and Asia.

cards.title: Untapped Resources
cards.description: Home to the longest coastline in Africa, vast arable land, and unexploited energy reserves.

cards.title: Reformed Business Climate
cards.description: New Company Laws and the One-Stop Business Registration System (SBRS) make starting a business faster than ever.

items.title: Livestock
items.description: The backbone of the economy. World leader in live animal exports.

items.title: Agriculture
items.description: Vast arable land along the Shabelle and Jubba rivers. Opportunities in bananas, sesame, and lemons.

items.title: Renewable Energy
items.description: Highest solar potential in the region. Investment ready for wind and solar grids.

items.title: Ports & Logistics
items.description: Strategic location on the Red Sea route. Modernizing ports to serve the Horn of Africa.

items.title: ICT & Finance
items.description: A cashless society driven by mobile money. Thriving telecom and fintech sector.

items.title: Tourism & Hospitality
items.description: Untapped potential in pristine beaches and historical sites for eco-tourism and hotels.

items.title: Register Company
items.description: Submit your application through the SBRS portal.

items.title: Obtain License
items.description: Coordinate with the Ministry of Commerce for licensing.

items.title: Investment Incentives
items.description: Engage SOMINVEST for priority sector incentives.

VisionPage.title: Centennial Vision 2060
VisionPage.description: A roadmap to a secure, democratic, and prosperous Somalia by our 100th year of independence.

mission.title: The Journey to 2060
mission.body: Vision 2060 is Somalia's long-term framework to transform the nation into a middle-income economy anchored by effective governance, inclusive growth, and a high quality of life. Recent milestones like the HIPC Debt Relief Completion and accession to the East African Community (EAC) provide critical foundations for sustained national renewal.

items.title: Inclusive Politics & Democratization
items.description: Finalizing the Federal Constitution, implementing One Person, One Vote elections, and strengthening the federal member state system.

items.title: Security & Rule of Law
items.description: Assuming full security responsibility from ATMIS, rebuilding the National Army (SNA), and establishing independent courts to ensure justice for all.

items.title: Economic Growth
items.description: Leveraging the Blue Economy (Fisheries), modernizing Agriculture, and energy diversification. Creating a welcoming climate for foreign and diaspora investment.

items.title: Social Development
items.description: Investing in human capital: Universal primary education, accessible healthcare, and empowering women and youth in the workforce.

items.title: Admission to EAC
items.description: Joining the East African Community.

items.title: Debt Relief (HIPC)
items.description: Completion of the debt relief process.

items.title: Constitutional Review & Elections
items.description: Advancing electoral reforms and governance.

items.title: Achieving SDGs
items.description: Progress toward the Sustainable Development Goals.

items.title: Centennial Celebration
items.description: A secure, democratic, and prosperous Somalia.

downloads.title: National Development Plan (NDP-9)
downloads.body: Access the full policy framework guiding Somalia's long-term transformation agenda.

ConstitutionPage.title: The Provisional Constitution
ConstitutionPage.description: The Supreme Law of the Federal Republic of Somalia.

sections.title: Chapter 1: Declaration of the Republic
sections.body: Somalia is a Federal, Sovereign, and Democratic Republic based on the Constitution and Islamic Sharia.

sections.title: Chapter 2: Fundamental Rights
sections.body: Human dignity, equality, freedom of expression, and the rights of the accused are protected.

sections.title: Chapter 3: Land & Property
sections.body: Land belongs to the people and is regulated by the state.

sections.title: Chapter 4: Public Representation
sections.body: Elections and political parties form the basis of representation.

sections.title: Chapter 5: Devolution of Powers
sections.body: Powers are distributed between the Federal Government and Member States.

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.description: How we protect your personal data and rights.
PrivacyPage.key_takeaways_body: This portal processes data under the Data Protection Act of 2023 and Article 14 of the Provisional Constitution (Right to Privacy). Data is collected only for service delivery, stored within Somalia, and protected by national encryption standards.

sections.title: Legal Basis
sections.content: Processing of personal data is governed by the Data Protection Act of 2023 and Article 14 of the Provisional Constitution, which guarantees the right to privacy. We process data only when there is a lawful basis and a clear public service purpose.

sections.title: Data Collection and Use
sections.content: We collect limited usage data (including cookies and analytics) to ensure secure, reliable, and efficient service delivery. Personal data provided through forms or service applications (including passport or identification services) is collected solely to provide the requested service, verify identity, and fulfill legal obligations.

sections.title: Data Sovereignty and Security
sections.content: All citizen data is stored securely on servers within the Federal Republic of Somalia and encrypted according to national standards. We apply administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect data from unauthorized access, alteration, or disclosure.

sections.title: Your Rights
sections.content: Citizens have the right to access, rectify, or request deletion of their personal data in accordance with the Data Protection Act of 2023. Requests should be directed through the National Identification and Registration Authority (NIRA), which is the authorized body for identity and data governance services.

TermsPage.title: Terms & Conditions
TermsPage.description: Rules governing the use of the Official Government Portal.

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content: These Terms & Conditions govern access to and use of the Official Government Portal. By using this portal, you agree to comply with these terms and all applicable laws of the Federal Republic of Somalia.

sections.title: 2. Disclaimer
sections.content: Information on this portal is for general guidance. Official Gazettes and legal decrees take precedence in all matters of law and policy.

sections.title: 3. Intellectual Property
sections.content: All content, including the Coat of Arms and Ministry Logos, is property of the Federal Government of Somalia. Unauthorized use, reproduction, or distribution is prohibited.

sections.title: 4. Misuse and Security
sections.content: Any attempt to hack, scrape, disrupt, or otherwise interfere with this service is a criminal offense under the National Penal Code. The Government reserves the right to investigate and prosecute unlawful activity.

sections.title: 5. Governing Law
sections.content: These terms are governed by the laws of the Federal Republic of Somalia. Disputes shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Mogadishu.

AccessibilityPage.title: Accessibility Statement
AccessibilityPage.description: Ensuring equal access for all citizens.

standard.title: Our Accessibility Standard
standard.body: We strive to meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards and evaluate the portal regularly to improve access for all users.

features.title: Compliance Features
items: Screen reader compatibility for core service flows.
Keyboard navigation across primary menus and forms.

inclusion.title: Commitment to Inclusion
inclusion.body: The Federal Government is committed to digital inclusion for persons with disabilities and will continue to improve accessibility features in line with international standards.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.body: If you encounter barriers, please contact <emailLink>accessibility@opm.gov.so</emailLink>.

ExecutivePage.title: The Executive Branch
ExecutivePage.description: The highest level of government leadership.

presidency.name: H.E. Hassan Sheikh Mohamud
presidency.title: President of the Federal Republic of Somalia
presidency.bio: Elected in May 2022, H.E. Hassan Sheikh Mohamud serves as the Head of State and symbol of national unity. He is the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces.

office.title: The Government Leadership
office.description: The Cabinet leadership responsible for execution of national policy.

leaders.name: H.E. Hamza Abdi Barre
leaders.title: Prime Minister
leaders.role: Head of Government, responsible for the Council of Ministers and implementation of national policy.

mandate.title: Executive Functions
mandate.body: The Executive Branch is responsible for enforcing laws, conducting foreign affairs, and managing the day-to-day operations of the federal government. It is accountable to the Parliament.
mandate.cta: View the Full Council of Ministers

CabinetPage.title: The Cabinet
CabinetPage.description: The Council of Ministers of the Federal Republic of Somalia

ParliamentPage.title: The Federal Parliament
ParliamentPage.description: The Bicameral Legislative Branch of the Federal Republic
ParliamentPage.intro: The Federal Parliament consists of two houses: The House of the People (275 seats) and the Upper House (54 seats). It is responsible for enacting laws, oversight of the executive, and representing the Somali people.

lower_house.title: The House of the People (Lower House)
lower_house.speaker_title: Speaker of the House of the People

StatesPage.title: Federal Member States
StatesPage.description: The Federal Republic is comprised of five Member States and the Benadir Regional Administration.

events.description: Celebrating the adoption of the Somali Latin script in 1972.

events.title: International Women's Day
events.description: Honoring the contribution of Somali women to nation-building.

events.title: National Army Day
events.description: Commemorating the establishment of the Somali National Armed Forces.

events.title: SYL Day
events.description: Honoring the Somali Youth League founders of 1943.

events.title: Independence Day (North)
events.description: Independence of Northern regions from British Protectorate.

events.title: Republic Day
events.description: Union of North & South and birth of the Somali Republic in 1960.

events.title: National Flag Day
events.description: Celebrating the adoption of the blue flag and white star in 1954.

HistoryPage.title: Our History
HistoryPage.description: From the Land of Punt to a Rising Republic: A story of resilience.

ancient.title: The Land of Punt
ancient.body: Somalia's story begins with the legendary Land of Punt, famed for its trade with Ancient Egypt. Medieval sultanates such as Adal and Ajuran flourished across the Horn, while Mogadishu emerged as a cosmopolitan hub described by Ibn Battuta as the City of Islam.

struggle.title: A Period of Resilience
struggle.body: The collapse of the state in 1991 and the civil war that followed tested the nation. Yet Somali communities kept commerce, faith, and culture alive through resilience, entrepreneurship, and mutual support, even in the absence of central government.

rising.title: Somalia Rising: Vision 2060
rising.body: Reconstruction continues across institutions and infrastructure, reinforced by debt relief victories in 2023 and 2024. Somalia's entry into the East African Community and the return of the diaspora are accelerating investment, education, and a bright national future.

items.title: Location
items.description: Horn of Africa, gateway to the Red Sea & Indian Ocean.

items.title: Coastline
items.description: 3,333 km - The longest in mainland Africa.

items.title: Economy
items.description: Livestock (50% of exports), Agriculture (Bananas/Sesame), Frankincense.

items.title: Capital
items.description: Mogadishu (The White Pearl).

items.title: Regions
items.description: 18 Pre-war Regions, organized into 5 Federal Member States + Benadir.

items.title: Official Languages
items.description: Somali (Maxaa-tiri) & Arabic.

hero.title: The Nation of Poets
hero.subtitle: A heritage of oral tradition, hospitality, and resilience.

items.name: Mohamed Ibrahim Warsame "Hadraawi"
items.description: The Shakespeare of Somalia, known for weaving social justice into romantic verse.

items.name: Sayid Mohamed Abdullah Hassan
items.quote: Dulmiga waan diiday, dalkayga waan dafiraa.
items.description: The leader of the Dervish state who used poetry as a weapon against colonialism.

items.name: Abdullahi Suldaan "Timacade"
items.description: The poet of Independence, celebrating the birth of the Republic in 1960.

customs.title: Soo Dhawoow: The Art of Hospitality
customs.body: Hospitality is a duty in Somali culture. A guest is a blessing from God, and generosity is a mark of honor. Refusing offered food or tea is often considered impolite.
customs.caption: Shaah (Spiced Tea) is the center of social life, spiced with cardamom and cloves.

tradition.title: Rhythm of the Land
tradition.body: The Dhaanto dance, often compared to early reggae rhythms, celebrates unity and courage, while Buraanbur honors the poetic artistry of Somali women. Traditional dress such as the Guntiino and the Macawis remain proud symbols of identity.

hero.title: Flavors of the Horn
hero.subtitle: A fusion of African, Arab, and Indian influences, centered on Halal traditions and generous hospitality.

philosophy.title: Soo Dhawoow (Welcome)
philosophy.body: In Somalia, food is a love language. To host a guest is a blessing. It is customary to share the best cut of meat and the freshest milk with visitors.

items.title: Bariis Iskukaris
items.description: Fragrant rice spiced with cardamom, cumin, and cloves, served with tender goat or camel meat.

items.title: Canjeero (Anjero)
items.description: A fermented sourdough pancake, the staple of every Somali breakfast, often dipped in sesame oil and sugar.

items.title: Sambusa
items.description: Crispy triangular pastries filled with spiced minced meat, onions, and green chilies. The ultimate snack.

items.title: Xalwo (Halwa)
items.description: The Sultan of Sweets. A dense, gelatinous confection made from sugar, cornstarch, and spices, reserved for weddings and Eid.

tea.title: The Art of Shaah
tea.body: Shaah is the linchpin of social life. Brewed with cardamom (hayl) and cloves, and served with plenty of sugar. It is drunk in the afternoon ('Asariya') as a time to connect and exchange news.

hero.title: Discover the Pearl of the Indian Ocean.
hero.subtitle: Ancient History. Pristine Beaches. Resilient Spirit.

items.title: Visas & Entry
items.description: Visa on Arrival (VOA) is available at Aden Adde International Airport ($60). E-Visa services are rolling out at visa.gov.so.

items.title: The Cashless Economy (EVC+)
items.description: Somalia is a cashless society. Mobile money (EVC Plus/Zaad) is used for everything from coffee to taxis.

items.title: Security & Logistics
items.description: Mogadishu has secure Green Zones. Visitors are advised to coordinate with local hosts or security details for excursions. Liido Beach and Peace Park are popular secure public spots.

items.title: Liido Beach
items.description: The vibrant heart of Mogadishu's social life. Seafood cafes, ocean breeze, and resilience.

items.title: Laas Geel
items.description: 5,000-year-old rock art near Hargeisa. One of the best-preserved Neolithic sites in Africa.

items.title: National Museum
items.description: Recently reopened, housing the artifacts and history of the Somali people.

items.title: Jazeera Beach
items.description: A serene, pristine stretch of coast for those seeking quiet beauty.
